title: 10 Easy Steps to Building Your Small Business Website
text:
PR Newswire Association LLC 
NEW YORK, Sept. 16, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- With modern consumers expecting brands to be online, starting a website for your business is a low-cost investment that enables you to reach a wider customer base and helps to establish credibility in the marketplace. Having a well-designed website can be an effective way to compete with larger brands in your industry and it doesn't need to be costly or confusing. For a website to be an effective sales tool: -- Know your customer. Knowing your customer and their needs is the number one thing you should understand before beginning to build the site. Remember that your website is for your customers and what you can do for them. Create a site that welcomes your consumer and use content on the site to convert them to a customer. -- Website words. Website copy is critically important and often overlooked. Create compelling content that weaves calls to action throughout the page and if you aren't converting site visitors to customers, have the copy on your site evaluated by a professional or end-user. -- Newsletter. While social media is one way to stay in touch with your followers, the ever-changing rules make it difficult to maintain a regular presence and a newsletter is a much simpler and consistent way to reach your followers.
